messages.title: ONLY A MAJORITY GOVERNMENT CAN GET ON WITH THE COUNTRY’S PRIORITIES
messages.content: A vote for Labour means another hung parliament. With Corbyn propped up by parties like the Scottish Nationalists. And they’re demanding ANOTHER referendum to break up Britain. That’s five long years of gridlock and uncertainty. SNP to back Labour government only with Scottish independence vote. At the end of this election, we’ll either get a Conservative majority – or a hung parliament. With your support, a Conservative majority government can get on with the country’s priorities.

messages.title: My Priorities for Aylesbury
messages.content: A SAFE AND SUSTAINABLE TOWN CENTRE: A hard line on anti-social behaviour so people feel safe on our streets; a better balanced town centre where people want to come for work and leisure, to live and shop. MORE SUPPORT FOR OUR LOCAL NHS: Standing up for Stoke Mandeville & Wycombe hospitals; campaigning for more GPs so patients can be seen sooner in their local surgeries. THE RIGHT INFRASTRUCTURE: Saying no to HS2 so we can protect our countryside; saying yes to better roads, modern transport connections and fast broadband for all.

quotes.text: At the end of this election, we’ll either get a Conservative majority – or a hung parliament.
With your support, a Conservative majority government can get on with the country’s priorities.

images.caption: Better hospitals. Safer streets. Improved schools. Let’s get on with our priorities.

examples: A vote for Labour means another hung parliament.
At the end of this election, we’ll either get a Conservative majority – or a hung parliament.
Government plans billions for hospital projects.
English schools to get three-year £14bn funding boost.
